main event: A civilian pilot reported seeing an object like a star, yellow-white in color, that seemed to be 5-6 times the size of a star and moved in an erratic manner across the sky.
interesting points: The object was observed for 6-7 minutes and then disappeared.
The pilot radioed the tower at San Antonio, and the tower also observed the object, but it soon disappeared.
Moonwatchers at Trinity University in San Antonio reported seeing an enormous glowing object that was moving eastward in quick bursts and was visible for about five minutes.
Radar at Kelly Air Force Base, San Antonio, also picked up the object, which was estimated to be over California around 11:30 p.m.

An eyewitness described the object as 'an enormous glowing thing arching across the sky from horizon to horizon' with radials appearing to be shooting off the object in a ponderous, almost lumbering manner.
sighted object: an object like a star, yellow-white in color, that seemed to be 5-6 times the size of a star and moved in an erratic manner
witnesses: a civilian pilot, moonwatchers at Trinity University, and radar at Kelly Air Force Base
